course_title: Special Topics: Film and Media: Global Media Cultures
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 25 / Seats Avail: 17Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
This course is designed as an upper-level, undergraduate seminar in which students will learn how media industries operate on the varied national, regional, and global levels. We will examine political, economic, technological, and cultural factors and their impacts on the production, circulation, and regulation of media products in today's global media landscape. We will also address questions regarding media industries' roles in representing different cultures on global screens. In this way, media production and consumption create cultural identities and differences.


MCP Elective
course_description: Rotating topics in film and media. May be repeated for credit when the topic varies.
prerequisites: FILM 102 and (FILM 201 or FILM 202 or FILM 203 or FILM 204 or FILM_OX 204 or FILM 205) or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisites.
